overview.description: A comprehensive introduction to Amazon Web Services (AWS) for beginners. Learn the fundamentals of cloud computing, AWS core services (EC2, S3, Lambda, etc.), security best practices, and how to deploy applications to AWS. Each lesson includes hands-on labs, practical examples, and real-world scenarios.
overview.target_audience: Beginners who want to learn AWS cloud computing and deploy applications to the cloud.
prerequisites: Familiarity with command line (helpful but not required)

modules.title: Introduction to Cloud Computing
modules.description: Understand the basics of cloud computing and its advantages.

lessons.title: What is Cloud Computing?
lessons.summary: Learn the definition and key characteristics of cloud computing.

hands_on_labs.title: Exploring Cloud Services
hands_on_labs.goal: Identify different cloud services and their use cases.

micro_exercises.title: Define Cloud Computing
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of cloud computing.

micro_exercises.title: List Benefits
micro_exercises.task: List at least three benefits of using cloud computing.

knowledge_check.question: What is cloud computing?
knowledge_check.answer: Cloud computing is the delivery of computing services over the internet.

knowledge_check.question: Name a benefit of cloud computing.
knowledge_check.answer: Scalability is a key benefit of cloud computing.

real_world_use_cases: Businesses using cloud for scalability

lessons.title: Types of Cloud Services
lessons.summary: Explore the different types of cloud services: IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.

hands_on_labs.title: Identifying Service Types
hands_on_labs.goal: Categorize different services into IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.

micro_exercises.title: Match Services
micro_exercises.task: Match the service type with its definition.

micro_exercises.title: List Examples
micro_exercises.task: List one example of IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.

knowledge_check.question: What does IaaS stand for?
knowledge_check.answer: Infrastructure as a Service.

knowledge_check.question: Give an example of PaaS.
knowledge_check.answer: Google App Engine is an example of PaaS.

objectives: Explain use cases for each type
real_world_use_cases: Using SaaS for CRM solutions

lessons.title: Cloud Deployment Models
lessons.summary: Learn about the different cloud deployment models: public, private, hybrid.

hands_on_labs.title: Evaluating Deployment Models
hands_on_labs.goal: Evaluate which deployment model fits a given scenario.

micro_exercises.title: Define Deployment Models
micro_exercises.task: Write definitions for public, private, and hybrid clouds.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Use Cases
micro_exercises.task: Identify a use case for each deployment model.

knowledge_check.question: What is a public cloud?
knowledge_check.answer: A public cloud is a cloud service offered over the public internet.

knowledge_check.question: What is a hybrid cloud?
knowledge_check.answer: A hybrid cloud combines public and private cloud resources.

objectives: Define public, private, and hybrid clouds
Identify use cases for each model
real_world_use_cases: Companies using hybrid cloud for flexibility

modules.title: Getting Started with AWS
modules.description: Learn how to set up and navigate the AWS Management Console.
module_outcomes: Understand AWS regions and availability zones

lessons.title: Creating an AWS Account
lessons.summary: Step-by-step guide to creating an AWS account.

hands_on_labs.title: Create Your AWS Account
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully create an AWS account and set up billing alerts.

micro_exercises.title: Account Creation Steps
micro_exercises.task: List the steps to create an AWS account.

micro_exercises.title: Billing Alerts
micro_exercises.task: Explain how to set up billing alerts in AWS.

knowledge_check.question: What is the first step to create an AWS account?
knowledge_check.answer: Visit the AWS website and click on 'Create an AWS Account'.

knowledge_check.question: Why are billing alerts important?
knowledge_check.answer: They help monitor and control AWS spending.

real_world_use_cases: Setting up an account for a startup

lessons.title: Navigating the AWS Management Console
lessons.summary: Learn how to navigate the AWS Management Console effectively.

hands_on_labs.title: Explore the Console
hands_on_labs.goal: Familiarize yourself with the AWS Management Console layout.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Components
micro_exercises.task: Identify and describe three key components of the AWS Management Console.

micro_exercises.title: Search Functionality
micro_exercises.task: Demonstrate how to use the search bar to find a service.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of the AWS Management Console?
knowledge_check.answer: It provides a web-based interface for managing AWS services.

knowledge_check.question: How can you quickly find a service in the console?
knowledge_check.answer: Use the search bar at the top of the console.

objectives: Identify key components of the console
real_world_use_cases: Finding services quickly in the console

lessons.title: Understanding AWS Regions and Availability Zones
lessons.summary: Learn about AWS regions and availability zones and their importance.

hands_on_labs.title: Identify Your Region
hands_on_labs.goal: Determine the nearest AWS region for your location.

micro_exercises.title: Define Regions
micro_exercises.task: Write a definition for AWS regions and availability zones.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Your Region
micro_exercises.task: Find and list the nearest AWS region to your location.

knowledge_check.question: What is an AWS region?
knowledge_check.answer: An AWS region is a geographical area that contains multiple availability zones.

knowledge_check.question: Why are availability zones important?
knowledge_check.answer: They provide redundancy and high availability for applications.

real_world_use_cases: Choosing the right region for deployment
common_mistakes: Not considering latency when choosing a region

modules.title: AWS Core Services
modules.description: Explore the core services offered by AWS, including EC2, S3, and Lambda.

lessons.title: Introduction to EC2
lessons.summary: Learn about Amazon EC2 and how to launch instances.

hands_on_labs.title: Launch Your First EC2 Instance
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully launch and connect to an EC2 instance.

micro_exercises.title: Define EC2
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of Amazon EC2.

micro_exercises.title: List Instance Types
micro_exercises.task: List at least three types of EC2 instances.

knowledge_check.question: What does EC2 stand for?
knowledge_check.answer: Elastic Compute Cloud.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of EC2?
knowledge_check.answer: To provide scalable computing capacity in the cloud.

real_world_use_cases: Hosting a web application on EC2

lessons.title: Working with S3
lessons.summary: Learn how to create and manage S3 buckets and objects.

hands_on_labs.title: Create and Manage an S3 Bucket
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully create an S3 bucket and upload objects.

micro_exercises.title: Define S3
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of Amazon S3.

micro_exercises.title: List S3 Operations
micro_exercises.task: List at least three operations you can perform on S3.

knowledge_check.question: What is Amazon S3 used for?
knowledge_check.answer: Amazon S3 is used for object storage in the cloud.

knowledge_check.question: How do you set permissions on an S3 bucket?
knowledge_check.answer: You can set permissions through the bucket policy or access control lists.

real_world_use_cases: Storing images for a website

lessons.title: Introduction to AWS Lambda
lessons.summary: Learn about AWS Lambda and how to create serverless functions.

hands_on_labs.title: Create Your First Lambda Function
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully create and invoke a Lambda function.

micro_exercises.title: Define Lambda
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of AWS Lambda.

micro_exercises.title: List Use Cases
micro_exercises.task: List at least two use cases for AWS Lambda.

knowledge_check.question: What is AWS Lambda used for?
knowledge_check.answer: AWS Lambda is used to run code in response to events without provisioning servers.

knowledge_check.question: How do you invoke a Lambda function?
knowledge_check.answer: You can invoke a Lambda function through the AWS Management Console or programmatically.

real_world_use_cases: Running code in response to events

modules.title: AWS Security Best Practices
modules.description: Learn about security best practices when using AWS.

lessons.title: Introduction to IAM
lessons.summary: Learn about AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM).

hands_on_labs.title: Create IAM Users
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully create IAM users and assign permissions.

micro_exercises.title: Define IAM
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of AWS IAM.

micro_exercises.title: List IAM Components
micro_exercises.task: List at least three components of IAM.

knowledge_check.question: What does IAM stand for?
knowledge_check.answer: Identity and Access Management.

knowledge_check.question: Why is IAM important?
knowledge_check.answer: It helps manage access to AWS resources securely.

real_world_use_cases: Managing user access in an organization
common_mistakes: Not following the principle of least privilege

lessons.title: Understanding Security Groups
lessons.summary: Learn how to configure security groups for your AWS resources.

hands_on_labs.title: Configure Security Groups
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully configure security groups for an EC2 instance.

micro_exercises.title: Define Security Groups
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of security groups.

micro_exercises.title: List Rules
micro_exercises.task: List at least three types of rules you can configure in a security group.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of a security group?
knowledge_check.answer: To control inbound and outbound traffic to AWS resources.

knowledge_check.question: How do you apply a security group?
knowledge_check.answer: You apply a security group when launching an EC2 instance or modifying an existing instance.

real_world_use_cases: Securing EC2 instances with security groups

lessons.title: Implementing Encryption in AWS
lessons.summary: Learn about encryption methods available in AWS.

hands_on_labs.title: Implement S3 Encryption
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully implement encryption for S3 buckets.

micro_exercises.title: Define Encryption
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of encryption.

micro_exercises.title: List Encryption Methods
micro_exercises.task: List at least two encryption methods available in AWS.

knowledge_check.question: What is encryption?
knowledge_check.answer: Encryption is the process of converting data into a coded format to prevent unauthorized access.

knowledge_check.question: What does KMS stand for?
knowledge_check.answer: Key Management Service.

real_world_use_cases: Protecting sensitive data in S3

modules.title: Deploying Applications on AWS
modules.description: Learn how to deploy applications using AWS services.

lessons.title: Deploying a Web Application
lessons.summary: Learn how to deploy a simple web application on AWS.

hands_on_labs.title: Deploy Your Web Application
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully deploy a static website using S3 and Route 53.

micro_exercises.title: Define Static Hosting
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of static website hosting.

micro_exercises.title: List Hosting Steps
micro_exercises.task: List the steps to host a static website on AWS.

knowledge_check.question: What is static website hosting?
knowledge_check.answer: Hosting a website where content does not change dynamically.

knowledge_check.question: What is Route 53 used for?
knowledge_check.answer: Route 53 is a scalable DNS web service.

real_world_use_cases: Hosting a portfolio website

lessons.title: Using Elastic Beanstalk
lessons.summary: Learn how to deploy applications using AWS Elastic Beanstalk.

hands_on_labs.title: Deploy an Application with Elastic Beanstalk
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully deploy an application using Elastic Beanstalk.

micro_exercises.title: Define Elastic Beanstalk
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of AWS Elastic Beanstalk.

micro_exercises.title: List Benefits
micro_exercises.task: List at least two benefits of using Elastic Beanstalk.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of Elastic Beanstalk?
knowledge_check.answer: To simplify the deployment of applications.

knowledge_check.question: How do you manage application versions in Elastic Beanstalk?
knowledge_check.answer: You can manage versions through the Elastic Beanstalk console.

real_world_use_cases: Deploying a web application with minimal configuration

lessons.title: Implementing CI/CD with AWS
lessons.summary: Learn how to implement Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment using AWS services.

hands_on_labs.title: Set Up a CI/CD Pipeline
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully set up a CI/CD pipeline using AWS CodePipeline.

micro_exercises.title: Define CI/CD
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment.

micro_exercises.title: List Pipeline Stages
micro_exercises.task: List the stages of a typical CI/CD pipeline.

knowledge_check.question: What does CI/CD stand for?
knowledge_check.answer: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of AWS CodePipeline?
knowledge_check.answer: To automate the build, test, and deployment phases of application development.

real_world_use_cases: Automating application deployment
common_mistakes: Not integrating testing in the pipeline

modules.title: Monitoring and Managing AWS Resources
modules.description: Learn how to monitor and manage your AWS resources effectively.

lessons.title: Introduction to AWS CloudWatch
lessons.summary: Learn how to monitor AWS resources using CloudWatch.

hands_on_labs.title: Set Up CloudWatch Alarms
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully set up CloudWatch alarms for your resources.

micro_exercises.title: Define CloudWatch
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of AWS CloudWatch.

micro_exercises.title: List Metrics
micro_exercises.task: List at least three metrics you can monitor with CloudWatch.

knowledge_check.question: What is AWS CloudWatch used for?
knowledge_check.answer: AWS CloudWatch is used for monitoring AWS resources and applications.

knowledge_check.question: How do you set up an alarm in CloudWatch?
knowledge_check.answer: You can set up an alarm through the CloudWatch console by selecting a metric and defining the alarm conditions.

real_world_use_cases: Monitoring application performance
common_mistakes: Not setting up alarms for critical metrics

lessons.title: Managing AWS Resources with AWS CLI
lessons.summary: Learn how to manage AWS resources using the AWS Command Line Interface (CLI).

hands_on_labs.title: Manage Resources with AWS CLI
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully manage AWS resources using the AWS CLI.

micro_exercises.title: Define AWS CLI
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of AWS CLI.

micro_exercises.title: List Commands
micro_exercises.task: List at least three commands you can use with AWS CLI.

knowledge_check.question: What is AWS CLI?
knowledge_check.answer: AWS CLI is a unified tool to manage AWS services from the command line.

knowledge_check.question: How do you install AWS CLI?
knowledge_check.answer: You can install AWS CLI using pip or by downloading the installer from the AWS website.

real_world_use_cases: Managing resources efficiently from the command line

lessons.title: Implementing Cost Management Strategies
lessons.summary: Learn how to manage and optimize costs in AWS.

hands_on_labs.title: Set Up AWS Budgets
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully set up AWS Budgets to monitor costs.

micro_exercises.title: Define Cost Management
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief definition of cost management in AWS.

micro_exercises.title: List Strategies
micro_exercises.task: List at least two strategies for optimizing costs in AWS.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of AWS Budgets?
knowledge_check.answer: AWS Budgets helps you set custom cost and usage budgets.

knowledge_check.question: How can you optimize resource usage?
knowledge_check.answer: By rightsizing instances and using reserved instances.

real_world_use_cases: Reducing AWS spending for a startup

modules.title: Capstone Project
modules.description: A comprehensive project to apply all the skills learned throughout the course.
module_outcomes: Design and deploy a full-stack application

lessons.title: Capstone Project Overview
lessons.summary: Introduction to the capstone project and its objectives.

hands_on_labs.title: Project Planning Session
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a project plan outlining the steps to complete the capstone.

micro_exercises.title: Define Project Objectives
micro_exercises.task: Write down the objectives for your capstone project.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Services
micro_exercises.task: List the AWS services you plan to use for your project.

knowledge_check.question: What is the first step in planning your capstone project?
knowledge_check.answer: Gathering project requirements.

knowledge_check.question: Why is it important to identify necessary AWS services?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure you have the right tools for your project.

real_world_use_cases: Building a full-stack application

lessons.title: Building the Application
lessons.summary: Hands-on session to build the application using AWS services.

hands_on_labs.title: Build and Deploy Your Application
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully build and deploy your application on AWS.

micro_exercises.title: Define Features
micro_exercises.task: List the key features of your application.

micro_exercises.title: Deployment Steps
micro_exercises.task: Outline the steps you will take to deploy your application.

knowledge_check.question: What is a key feature of your application?
knowledge_check.answer: The specific functionality that addresses user needs.

knowledge_check.question: Why is testing important before deployment?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure the application works as intended and is free of bugs.

real_world_use_cases: Deploying a web application

lessons.title: Final Presentation and Review
lessons.summary: Present your capstone project and review the learning outcomes.

hands_on_labs.title: Prepare Your Presentation
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a presentation summarizing your capstone project.

micro_exercises.title: Outline Your Presentation
micro_exercises.task: Create an outline for your project presentation.

micro_exercises.title: Feedback Questions
micro_exercises.task: List questions you want to ask for feedback after your presentation.

knowledge_check.question: What should you include in your presentation?
knowledge_check.answer: Key features, challenges faced, and solutions implemented.

knowledge_check.question: Why is feedback important?
knowledge_check.answer: It helps improve future projects and skills.

real_world_use_cases: Showcasing your work to stakeholders
